No Poverty.reason: The course directly focuses on poverty, its causes, consequences, and solutions through community engagement and policy analysis.

Zero Hunger.reason: Community internships include food banks, which relate to addressing hunger among vulnerable populations.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Course discusses poverty and health, linking economic status to well-being outcomes.

Quality Education.reason: Indirectly relevant through student learning and skill development, but not a core focus of the course.

Gender Equality.reason: Course materials do not explicitly focus on gender-related issues within poverty economics.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: No explicit content related to water or sanitation issues is mentioned in the syllabus.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: No coverage of energy topics in relation to poverty or economic analysis is indicated.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Course covers entrepreneurship and policy analysis, which can relate to economic opportunities and growth for marginalized populations.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Limited relevance; innovation in community solutions is touched upon, but not industrial or infrastructural development.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: A major focus on income inequality, social disparities, and policy interventions to reduce poverty.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Community engagement and practical solutions in local settings link moderately to sustainable communities.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: Not explicitly addressed in course content or assignments.

Climate Action.reason: No mention of climate-related issues in course syllabus.

Life Below Water.reason: No topics addressing marine life or aquatic ecosystems are included.

Life on Land.reason: No explicit discussion of terrestrial ecosystems or biodiversity.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Course explores political economy of poverty, social justice, and institutional responses, moderately relevant.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Collaboration with community organizations and USR projects provides some linkage to partnerships.
